project_description: A Flutter application that multiplies a counter value by 10 using the Cubit pattern for state management.
architecture_overview: The project follows a modular architecture with separate folders for screens, cubits, models, and widgets. The Cubit pattern is used for state management, and each component is designed to be highly reusable.

sequence_diagram:
@startuml
actor User
User -> HomeScreen: Launch App
HomeScreen -> CounterCubit: Get initial counter value
CounterCubit -> Counter: Initialize with value 0
Counter -> HomeScreen: Return initial value
HomeScreen -> CounterDisplay: Display value
User -> IncrementButton: Press
IncrementButton -> CounterCubit: Increment value
CounterCubit -> Counter: Update value by 10
Counter -> CounterCubit: Return updated value
CounterCubit -> HomeScreen: Return updated value
HomeScreen -> CounterDisplay: Update display
@enduml
state_management_flow: The state is managed using the Cubit pattern. The CounterCubit class manages the state of the counter, including incrementing its value by 10. The HomeScreen widget listens to state changes from the CounterCubit and updates the UI accordingly.
navigation_flow: The app has a single screen, HomeScreen, which displays the counter value and an increment button. Navigation is minimal as this is a single-screen application.
